Resume data

resume_data.Rd

This function summarizes the data in a dataframe according to user-defined groups and functions. In particular, it allows you to calculate the intensity and frequency of disease attack per plot.

Utilisation

resume_data(
  data,
  var_col,
  group_cols,
  funs = list(intensite = intensity, frequence = incidence),
  code_tnt = "TNT",
  df_tnt = NULL
)

Arguments

data

a dataframe to resume

var_col

character, the colname of the variable to plot

group_cols

colnames for grouping

funs

vector of statistics to be applied, by default c("intensity","incidence")

code_tnt

for efficacy only : a string to identify in TNT in the row of the dataframe by default "TNT"

df_tnt

for efficacy only : a dataframe to associate tnt_id to bloc_id or plot_id. tnt_id is the plot_id of TNT and MUST be a col of df_tnt

Valeur de retour

a dataframe with group_cols and including a 'calculation' column which specifies the name of the functions applied to the variable and a 'value' column which gives the calculated values.
